results.title: Yellow Pages: Goggomobil [advertisement]
results.brief_description: Tommy Dysart stars as the man searching through the Yellow Pages business telephone directory for a mechanic who can help his beloved, a rare ‘Goggomobil’ car from the 1950s (‘not the Dart’).

results.title: Lamb Roast [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Naomi Watts stars in this commercial as the girl that wins a date with Tom Cruise but turns it down so she can be at home for one of her Mum’s lamb roasts.
Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Jollies
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: An intimate and sardonic work about being an adolescent in mid-American suburbia. From touching the genitals of boys in school to finally getting to kiss the girl she wants, this very funny and accomplished experimental work was filmed while the director was herself a teen.

results.title: Blue Tongue
results.creator_credit: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne, Timothy Jolley and Justin Kurzel
results.brief_description:
On the fringes of a housing estate a girl seduces a boy with a secret she will only reveal in exchange for his love. When the boy fails to honour the pact, what he holds close is threatened by the girl’s desire for revenge. Cast: Arlan Fahey Leigh and Siana Smit.
In 2005 ‘Blue Tongue’ was the first Australian short film to be selected for screening at the International Critics Week at the Cannes International Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne, Timothy Jolley and Justin Kurzel

results.title: Marco Solo
results.creator_credit: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne and Adrian Bosich
results.brief_description:
Poor Marco. Accidentally born into an overcrowded Australian-Italian household, he is relegated to his parents’ bedroom. Nine years later, armed with a vivid imagination, an obsession with Dame Edna, and a warped sense of Catholicism, Marco searches for a space of his own. Cast includes Joseph Sollena, Robert Urban, Helen Nicholas, Irini Pappas, Maria Diele.
‘Marco Solo’ screened at many film festivals, including Palm Springs and London International Film Festival.

results.title: The Judy spots
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description:
‘The Judy spots’ consists of five short videos featuring a papier-mache puppet called Judy. Clever, witty and extremely dark, each of the vignettes is a social commentary about human emotions and behavior.
The vignettes are: ‘Judy feels sad’, ‘Judy hates her job’, ‘Judy has a nightmare’, ‘Judy goes to the mall’ and ‘Judy gets mad’.

results.brief_description: Partly shot in Pixelvision and partly in Super 8 and using a combination of hand-drawn masks, animation and live action, this experimental film explores the theme of gender identity through the eyes of androgenous 11-year-old Taylor (Sammy Steel).

results.title: Winners: Top Kid
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, Bob Ellis, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Gary is a bright boy - a bit too bright for his own good, as the other kids try to prove by beating him up regularly after school. Then he goes on a quiz show and suddenly fame and fortune are within his reach… until they start to rig the show and Gary has to make a very difficult decision.

Cast includes Emil Minty, Harold Hopkins, Michelle Fawdon and Garry McDonald.

results.title: Winners: Room to Move
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Richard Mason, Julia Overton, New South Wales Film Corporation, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, ITC Entertainment and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Carol is a top runner, coached by her father day and night. Then she makes friends with Angie, the new girl at school whose punk looks haven’t made her very popular. Angie introduces Carol to the wonderful world of dance, but Carol’s father won’t let her do anything that conflicts with her track-training. Parental pressure is tough on Carol who wants to succeed. She rebels and plans a new life for herself, but the all-important race is coming up and Carol has to give it all she’s got.

Cast includes Nicole Kidman, Terence Donovan and Alyssa Cook.
